Steam (ST): After Genji finished his late meal, he went out to do the nighttime rounds inside the mansion.
Umineko Project (UP): After Genji finished taking his late meal, he went out to do the nighttime rounds inside the mansion.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): After Genji finished taking his late meal, he went out to do the nighttime rounds inside the mansion.
PC Japanese (JP): 源次は遅めの食事を取り終えた後、屋敷内の夜の見回りに出ていた。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 源次は遅めの食事を取り終えた後、屋敷内の夜の見回りに出ていた。
Russian (RU): После того как Генджи закончил свою позднюю трапезу, он вышел, чтобы сделать ночной обход по особняку.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Após Genji terminar de fazer sua refeição noturna, ele saiu para fazer a ronda dentro da mansão.
Vietnamese (VI): After Genji finished taking his late meal, he went out to do the nighttime rounds inside the mansion.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 源次用完略迟于平时的晚餐后，开始了大屋内的夜间巡视。

Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Dopo aver consumato la sua cena posticipata, Genji uscì per effettuare i controlli notturni nella villa.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Dopo aver tardivamente consumato la sua cena, Genji uscì per effettuare la ronda notturna della villa.
Turkish (TR): Genji geç saatte hazırladığı yemeğini bitirdikten sonra malikânede gece devriyesi yapmaya çıktı.

Steam (ST): He'd eaten some reheated soup that Gohda had made, along with some random leftovers from the refrigerator.
Umineko Project (UP): He reheated the soup that Gohda had started making, and ate some random leftovers from the refrigerator.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): He ate some reheated soup that Gohda had made, along with some random leftovers from the refrigerator.
PC Japanese (JP): 食事は、郷田が作りかけていたスープを温めなおし、冷蔵庫の中にあった残り物を適当に食べた。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 食事は、郷田が作りかけていたスープを温めなおし、冷蔵庫の中にあった残り物を適当に食べた。
Russian (RU): Он съел немного тёплого супа, приготовленного Годой, а также кое‐какие оставшиеся в холодильнике продукты.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ele reaqueceu a sopa que Gohda havia começado a preparar e comeu algumas sobras que estavam na geladeira.
Vietnamese (VI): He reheated the soup that Gohda had started making, and ate some random leftovers from the refrigerator.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 晚餐時，他重新熱了下鄉田快做好的西餐湯，再隨便吃了點冰箱中的剩菜。

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Come pasto, riscaldò della zuppa preparata da Gouda, assieme a qualche avanzo presente nel frigo.

Steam (ST): Those were all things Gohda had made himself, and were, of course, delicious.
Umineko Project (UP): They were all things Gohda had made himself, and were, of course, delicious.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): They were all things Gohda had made himself, and were, of course, delicious.

Russian (RU): Всё это Года приготовил сам, и получилось у него, разумеется, очень вкусно.

Vietnamese (VI): They were all things Gohda had made himself, and were, of course, delicious.

Steam (ST): He had half-heartedly gone to ask Rosa and the others what they would do for dinner, but he'd been yelled at by a voice telling him that the canned food they had would be enough, and the door wasn't even opened for him.
Umineko Project (UP): He had half‐heartedly gone to ask Rosa and the others what they would do for dinner, but he had been yelled at by a voice telling him that they had canned food so they were fine, and the door wasn't even opened for him.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): He had half-heartedly gone to ask Rosa and the others what they would do for dinner, but he had been yelled at by a voice telling him that they had canned food so they were fine, and the door wasn't even opened for him.
PC Japanese (JP): 楼座たちに、夕食をどうするか一応聞きには行ったが、缶詰を食べるからいいと怒鳴られ、扉も開けてもらえなかった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 楼座たちに、夕食をどうするか一応聞きには行ったが、缶詰を食べるからいいと怒鳴られ、扉も開けてもらえなかった。
Russian (RU): Он нехотя пошел спросить Розу и остальных, что они будут есть на обед, но дверь ему не открыли и крикнули, что у них есть консервы, поэтому они в порядке.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ele, sem ânimo, foi perguntar à Rosa e aos outros o que eles iriam querer para o jantar, mas gritaram dizendo que eles ficariam bem comendo comida enlatada, e a porta não foi aberta para ele.
Vietnamese (VI): He had half‐heartedly gone to ask Rosa and the others what they would do for dinner, but he had been yelled at by a voice telling him that they had canned food so they were fine, and the door wasn't even opened for him.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 雖然源次也去過樓座他們那裡，問了下晚飯要怎麼辦，但是樓座只是怒吼道“我們吃罐頭，不用了”，連門都沒開。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 虽然源次也去过楼座他们那里，问了下晚饭要怎么办，但是楼座只是怒吼道“我们吃罐头，不用了”，连门都没开。
Indonesian (IDN): He had half‐heartedly gone to ask Rosa and the others what they would do for dinner, but he had been yelled at by a voice telling him that they had canned food so they were fine, and the door wasn't even opened for him.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Con riluttanza era andato a chiedere a Rosa cosa avevano intenzione di fare riguardo alla cena, ma gli era stato gridato contro che avevano del cibo in scatola e quindi erano a posto, e non avevano nemmeno aperto la porta per lui.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Era andato dal gruppo di Rosa per provare a chiedere cosa avevano intenzione di fare per la cena, ma gli era stato urlato contro che erano a posto perché avevano del cibo in scatola, e non gli aprirono neanche la porta...
Turkish (TR): Rosa ve diğerlerine akşam yemeği için ne yiyeceklerini sormak için isteksizce yanlarına gitmişti ama konserve yiyecekleri olduğunu, yani sorun olmadığını söyleyen bir ses tarafından terslenmişti, ve kapı onun için açılmamıştı bile.

Steam (ST): ...So, ironically, the servant Genji was able to eat a more delicious meal...
Umineko Project (UP): ......So, ironically, it was the servant Genji who was able to eat the more delicious meal...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......So ironically, the servant Genji was able to eat a more delicious meal...
PC Japanese (JP): ……なので皮肉にも、使用人である源次の方が美味しい食事を口に出来たのだった…。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ……なので皮肉にも、使用人である源次の方が美味しい食事を口に出来たのだった…。
Russian (RU): ......Таким образом, по иронии судьбы, слуга Генджи получил возможность поесть более вкусную еду...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Então, ironicamente, foi o serviçal, Genji, quem pôde saborear uma refeição deliciosa...
Vietnamese (VI): ......So, ironically, it was the servant Genji who was able to eat the more delicious meal...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……所以享用到了美味食物的，反而是身為傭人的源次…，真是諷刺。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……所以享用到了美味食物的，反而是身为佣人的源次…，真是讽刺。

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): E così, per ironia della sorte, il domestico Genji potè gustarsi un pasto più saporito di quello dei suoi padroni...
Turkish (TR): ......Böylece, ironik olarak, en lezzetli yemeği yiyebilen kişi, hizmetkâr Genji oldu...

Steam (ST): ...But why was it that Genji wasn't afraid to do the rounds all by himself, even though all of those crimes had been committed and many people had already met a brutal end?
Umineko Project (UP): But even though all of those crimes had been committed, and many people had already met a brutal end, ......why was it that Genji wasn't afraid to do the rounds all by himself?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......But why was it that Genji wasn't afraid to do the rounds all by himself, even though all of those crimes had been committed, and many people had already met a brutal end?
PC Japanese (JP): しかし、あれほどの事件が起こり、すでに何人もの人間が無惨な最期を迎えているというのに、……源次はなぜたったひとりで見回りに出ることが恐ろしくないのか。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): しかし、あれほどの事件が起こり、すでに何人もの人間が無惨な最期を迎えているというのに、……源次はなぜたったひとりで見回りに出ることが恐ろしくないのか。
Russian (RU): ......Но почему Генджи не боялся делать обход в одиночку, несмотря на совершенные преступления и людей, уже встретивших жестокий конец?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mas, mesmo tendo acontecido todos esses crimes, e muitas pessoas terem tido uma morte brutal, ......por que Genji não tinha medo de fazer a ronda sozinho?
Vietnamese (VI): But even though all of those crimes had been committed, and many people had already met a brutal end, ......why was it that Genji wasn't afraid to do the rounds all by himself?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不過，明明已經發生了這麼多事件，慘死了好幾個人，……可源次為什麼還一點都不怕孤身一人去巡視呢？
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不过，明明已经发生了这么多事件，惨死了好几个人，……可源次为什么还一点都不怕孤身一人去巡视呢？
Indonesian (IDN): But even though all of those crimes had been committed, and many people had already met a brutal end, ......why was it that Genji wasn't afraid to do the rounds all by himself?
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Ma come mai Genji non aveva paura di fare il giro di ronda completamente solo, nonostante fossero stati commessi tutti quei crimini, e tanti avevano già incontrato una fine brutale?
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Ma come mai, dopo tutti quei crimini commessi e tutte quelle persone che erano andate incontro ad una macabra fine... Genji non aveva timore di fare il giro di ronda completamente da solo...?
Turkish (TR): Ama, onca suç işlenmiş ve pek çok insan acımasız bir ölümle karşılaşmış olmasına rağmen, ......neden Genji tek başına dolaşmaktan korkmuyordu?

Steam (ST): ...Judging by his appearance as he carried out his usual tasks without a trace of fear, as though everything was normal, you might think all of the horrible events that day had been no more than a dream or an illusion.
Umineko Project (UP): ...Judging by his appearance as he carried out his normal tasks without a trace of fear, as though everything was normal, you might think that all of the horrible events that had happened today were just a dream or an illusion.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...Judging by his appearance as he carried out his normal tasks without a trace of fear, as though everything was normal, you might think that all of the horrible events that had happened today were just a dream or an illusion.
PC Japanese (JP): …何の怯えもなく、普段通りの仕事を当り前にこなす彼のその様子を見ていると、今日の凄惨な出来事全てが、まるで夢か幻だったのではないかと思わされてしまうに違いない。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): …何の怯えもなく、普段通りの仕事を当り前にこなす彼のその様子を見ていると、今日の凄惨な出来事全てが、まるで夢か幻だったのではないかと思わされてしまうに違いない。
Russian (RU): ...Судя по его виду, он выполнял свои обычные обязанности без тени страха, как будто всё было в норме. Можно было подумать, что все ужасные события, произошедшие сегодня, были всего лишь сном или иллюзией.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Julgando pela sua aparência e como ele executa suas tarefas normalmente e sem medo, como se tudo fosse normal, você poderia pensar que todos os eventos horríveis que aconteceram hoje foram apenas um sonho ou uma ilusão.
Vietnamese (VI): ...Judging by his appearance as he carried out his normal tasks without a trace of fear, as though everything was normal, you might think that all of the horrible events that had happened today were just a dream or an illusion.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …看了他這副泰然自若，如平常一樣十分自然地巡視著的樣子，一定會讓人覺得，今天發生的所有慘事，會不會根本是一場夢幻。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …看了他这副泰然自若，如平常一样十分自然地巡视着的样子，一定会让人觉得，今天发生的所有惨事，会不会根本是一场梦幻。
Indonesian (IDN): ...Judging by his appearance as he carried out his normal tasks without a trace of fear, as though everything was normal, you might think that all of the horrible events that had happened today were just a dream or an illusion.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... A giudicare dal suo aspetto mentre eseguiva i compiti di sempre senza un briciolo di paura, come se fosse tutto nella norma, si sarebbe potuto credere che tutti gli orribili eventi accaduti quel giorno fossero stati solo un sogno o un'illusione.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): A giudicare dall'aria con cui eseguiva con naturalezza le sue mansioni ordinarie, senza avere alcuna paura, si sarebbe potuto pensare che ogni orrida vicenda di quel giorno fosse stata un sogno o un'allucinazione.
Turkish (TR): ...Görünüşüne bakıldığında, her şey normalmiş gibi normal görevlerini hiçbir korku izi olmadan yerine getirdiğinden, bugün meydana gelen tüm korkunç olayların sadece bir rüya veya illüzyon olduğu düşünülebilirdi.

Steam (ST): Was he taking a philosophic view, or had he just accepted his fate?
Umineko Project (UP): Was he taking a philosophic view, or was it simply resignation?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Was he taking a philosophic view, or was it simply resignation?
PC Japanese (JP): それは、ある種の達観なのか、それとも諦観なのか。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): それは、ある種の達観なのか、それとも諦観なのか。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Isso era fruto de uma visão filosófica, ou seria simples resignação?
Vietnamese (VI): Was he taking a philosophic view, or was it simply resignation?

Chinese Simplified (CN): 这是某种大彻大悟吗，还是看破了红尘呢？
Indonesian (IDN): Was he taking a philosophic view, or was it simply resignation?

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Stava prendendo la situazione con filosofia, oppure era semplice rassegnazione?
Turkish (TR): Felsefi bir bakış açısına mı sahipti, yoksa sadece teslimiyet miydi?

Steam (ST): Genji must have considered it a virtue that, when the fate that awaited him was unavoidable, he carry out his duty systematically until the last moment.
Umineko Project (UP): Genji must have considered it a virtue to systematically carry out his duty until the last moment, since the fate that awaited him was unavoidable.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Genji must have considered it a virtue to systematically carry out his duty until the last moment, since the fate that awaited him was unavoidable.
PC Japanese (JP): 源次にとって、自分を待ち受ける運命が不可避であるならば、その瞬間まで勤めを整然と果たすことがきっと美徳であったに違いない。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 源次にとって、自分を待ち受ける運命が不可避であるならば、その瞬間まで勤めを整然と果たすことがきっと美徳であったに違いない。
Russian (RU): Генджи, должно быть, счел достойным систематически выполнять свой долг до последнего момента, поскольку ожидавшая его судьба была неизбежна.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Genji deve ter considerado que era uma virtude continuar sistematicamente seu trabalho até o último momento, já que o destino que o aguardava era inevitável.
Vietnamese (VI): Genji must have considered it a virtue to systematically carry out his duty until the last moment, since the fate that awaited him was unavoidable.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 毫無疑問對源次來說，如果等候著自己的命運無法避免，那麼有條不紊地工作到那一瞬間，就是他的美德。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 毫无疑问对源次来说，如果等候着自己的命运无法避免，那么有条不紊地工作到那一瞬间，就是他的美德。
Indonesian (IDN): Genji must have considered it a virtue to systematically carry out his duty until the last moment, since the fate that awaited him was unavoidable.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Genji doveva considerare fare sistematicamente il suo dovere una virtù, dato che il destino che lo attendeva era inevitabile.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Se il destino che attendeva Genji era inevitabile, per uno come lui era senz'altro una virtù compiere regolarmente il proprio dovere fino all'ultimo.
Turkish (TR): Genji, kendisini bekleyen kader kaçınılmaz olduğundan, görevini son ana kadar sistematik bir şekilde yerine getirmeyi bir erdem olarak görmüş olmalıydı.

Steam (ST): The depths of his heart would probably remain hidden for all eternity, unless he spoke of them himself...
Umineko Project (UP): It would probably be eternally impossible to perceive the depths of his heart, unless he told of it himself......
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It would probably be impossible to perceive the depths of his heart for all eternity, unless he told of it himself......
PC Japanese (JP): 彼の心の奥底をうかがい知ることは、彼が自ら語らぬ限り、永遠に不可能だろう……。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 彼の心の奥底をうかがい知ることは、彼が自ら語らぬ限り、永遠に不可能だろう……。
Russian (RU): Вероятно, и вечности не хватило бы для постижения глубин его души, если бы он только сам не рассказал о себе...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): As profundezas de seu coração permaneceriam escondidas por toda a eternidade, a não ser que ele mesmo dissesse...
Vietnamese (VI): It would probably be eternally impossible to perceive the depths of his heart, unless he told of it himself......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 要窺視他的心靈深處，除非他自己講述，不然永遠都是不可能的吧……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 要窥视他的心灵深处，除非他自己讲述，不然永远都是不可能的吧……。
Indonesian (IDN): It would probably be eternally impossible to perceive the depths of his heart, unless he told of it himself......

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Desumere i meandri dei suoi pensieri sarebbe stata un'impresa perennemente impossibile, a meno che non ne avesse parlato lui stesso...
Turkish (TR): Kendisi anlatmadığı sürece, kalbinin derinliklerini algılamak muhtemelen sonsuza dek imkansız olacaktı......

Steam (ST): He had returned his master key to Rosa, so the places he could reach were extremely limited.
Umineko Project (UP): Because he had given the master key back to Rosa, the places he could go to were extremely limited.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Because he had given the master key back to Rosa, the places he could go to were extremely limited.

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Avendo restituito il passepartout a Rosa, i luoghi che poteva sorvegliare erano considerevolmente limitati.

Steam (ST): All he could do was walk around the hallways, checking to make sure all the windows were closed. That probably made his rounds go a lot faster than usual.
Umineko Project (UP): All he could do was walk around the hallways, checking to make sure that the windows were closed.{n}So he was able to go around that route far more quickly than usual.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): All he could do was walk around the hallways, checking to make sure that the windows were closed. So he was probably able to go around that route far more quickly than usual.
PC Japanese (JP): せいぜい廊下を回り、窓の戸締りを確認するくらいだ。だから、普段よりもだいぶ早く順路を回れるのだった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): せいぜい廊下を回り、窓の戸締りを確認するくらいだ。{n}だから、普段よりもだいぶ早く順路を回れるのだった。
Russian (RU): Все, что он мог делать — это ходить по коридорам, проверяя, закрыты ли окна.{n}Таким образом, он мог пройти свой маршрут гораздо быстрее, чем обычно.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Tudo o que ele podia fazer era andar pelos corredores, conferindo para ter certeza de que as janelas estavam fechadas.{n}Ele então foi capaz de seguir sua rota de forma mais rápida que a de costume.

Turkish (TR): Tek yapabildiği koridorlarda dolaşmak, pencerelerin kapalı olup olmadığını kontrol etmekti.{n}Bu yüzden normalden çok daha hızlı bir şekilde bu rotayı dolaşabildi.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Rosa
Steam (ST): "Battler-kun, wait! Just in case, let's check the doors and windows of this room. Wait a second."
Umineko Project (UP): "Battler‐kun, wait! Just in case, I'm going to check the doors and windows of this room before we go. Wait a second."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Battler-kun, wait! Just in case, let's check the doors and windows of this room. Wait a second."
PC Japanese (JP): 「戦人くん、待って！　念の為、部屋の戸締りを確認していくわ。ちょっと待ってね。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「戦人くん、待って！　念の為、部屋の戸締りを確認していくわ。ちょっと待ってね」
Russian (RU): "Баттлер‐кун, подожди! На всякий случай, давай проверим двери и окна в этой комнате. Подожди секунду."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Battler‐kun, espere! Primeiro, eu vou checar as portas e janelas deste quarto antes de irmos. Espere um segundo."
Vietnamese (VI): "Battler‐kun, wait! Just in case, I'm going to check the doors and windows of this room before we go. Wait a second."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「戰人君，等一下！小心為上，我去檢查下房間裡的窗戶有沒有鎖好。稍微等一會哦。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「战人君，等一下！小心为上，我去检查下房间里的窗户有没有锁好。稍微等一会哦。」
Indonesian (IDN): "Battler‐kun, wait! Just in case, I'm going to check the doors and windows of this room before we go. Wait a second."
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Battler-kun, aspetta! Controlliamo le porte e le finestre di questa stanza, per sicurezza. Aspetta un attimo."
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "Aspetta, Battler-kun! Per sicurezza, controllerò se le porte e le finestre di questa stanza siano chiuse. Attendete un attimo."
Turkish (TR): "Battler-kun, bekle! Her ihtimale karşı, gitmeden önce bu odanın kapı ve pencerelerini kontrol edeceğim. Bekle bir saniye."

Steam (ST): Aunt Rosa called me to a halt to prevent me from going on ahead and began to carefully check the locks on each of the windows.
Umineko Project (UP): Auntie Rosa called me to a halt to prevent me from going on ahead, and began to carefully check the locks on each of the windows.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Rosa oba-san called me to a halt to prevent me from going on ahead, and began to carefully check the locks on each of the windows.
PC Japanese (JP): 楼座叔母さんは、俺だけが先に行かないように呼び止め、それぞれの窓の施錠を入念に確認し始めた。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 楼座叔母さんは、俺だけが先に行かないように呼び止め、それぞれの窓の施錠を入念に確認し始めた。
Russian (RU): Тётя Роза позвала меня, чтобы не дать мне идти впереди, и начать внимательно проверять замки на каждом из окон.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A tia Rosa me chamou para evitar que eu fosse na frente, e começou a checar as trancas cuidadosamente, uma por uma.
Vietnamese (VI): Auntie Rosa called me to a halt to prevent me from going on ahead, and began to carefully check the locks on each of the windows.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 樓座姑母為了不讓我一個人先走而叫住了我，然後小心翼翼地檢查起了每一扇窗戶的鎖。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 楼座姑母为了不让我一个人先走而叫住了我，然后小心翼翼地检查起了每一扇窗户的锁。
Indonesian (IDN): Auntie Rosa called me to a halt to prevent me from going on ahead, and began to carefully check the locks on each of the windows.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Rosa oba-san mi disse di fermarmi per evitare che andassi avanti, e iniziò a controllare attentamente la serratura di ogni finestra.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Zia Rosa mi intimò di fermarmi, per far sì che non andassi avanti, e iniziò a controllare scrupolosamente la serratura di ciascuna finestra...
Turkish (TR): Rosa Teyze ilerlememi önlemek için beni durdurdu ve pencerelerin kilitlerini dikkatle kontrol etmeye başladı.

Steam (ST): ...But those locks had already been checked once.
Umineko Project (UP): ......But those locks had already been checked once.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......But those locks had already been checked once.
PC Japanese (JP): ……でも、その施錠の確認はすでに一度行なっている。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ……でも、その施錠の確認はすでに一度行なっている。
Russian (RU): ......Но эти замки были уже проверены.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Mas aquelas trancas já haviam sido conferidas uma vez.
Vietnamese (VI): ......But those locks had already been checked once.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……不過，有沒有鎖好是已經檢查過一次的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……不过，有没有锁好是已经检查过一次的。
Indonesian (IDN): ......But those locks had already been checked once.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Ma quelle serrature erano state già controllate una volta.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Ma il controllo di quelle serrature era già stato effettuato una volta...
Turkish (TR): ......Ama o kilitler zaten bir kez kontrol edilmişti.

Steam (ST): ...It felt kind of unpleasant, as though she suspected that I might've secretly unlocked them when she wasn't looking.
Umineko Project (UP): ......It felt kind of unpleasant, as though she suspected that I might have secretly unlocked them when she wasn't looking.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......It felt kind of unpleasant, as though she suspected that I might have secretly unlocked them when she wasn't looking.
PC Japanese (JP): ……まるで、楼座叔母さんの目を盗んで、俺がこっそりと鍵を開けたのではないかと疑われているようで気分が悪い。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ……まるで、楼座叔母さんの目を盗んで、俺がこっそりと鍵を開けたのではないかと疑われているようで気分が悪い。
Russian (RU): ......На душе от этого становилось неприятно, как будто она подозревала, что я мог тайно их открыть, когда она не следила за мной.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Eu me senti um pouco desconfortável, como se ela suspeitasse que eu secretamente pudesse ter aberto uma delas enquanto ela não estava olhando.
Vietnamese (VI): ......It felt kind of unpleasant, as though she suspected that I might have secretly unlocked them when she wasn't looking.

Umineko Project (UP): ...No, maybe she was right to be this cautious...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...No, maybe Rosa oba-san was right for being this cautious...

Steam (ST): Though it was called a courtyard, it wasn't really a pretty place you could take a walk in, like the rose garden.
Umineko Project (UP): Even though it was called a courtyard, it wasn't really a pretty place you could take a walk in like the rose garden.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Even though it was called a courtyard, it wasn't really a pretty place you could take a walk in like the rose garden.
PC Japanese (JP): 中庭とは言っても、別に薔薇庭園などのような散策のできる美しい場所というわけではなかった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 中庭とは言っても、別に薔薇庭園などのような散策のできる美しい場所というわけではなかった。
Russian (RU): Место, носившее имя "внутренний двор", не было действительно красивым местом, куда ходили гулять, как в розарий.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mesmo que seja chamado de pátio, não é realmente um lugar bonito onde você pode caminhar como no jardim de rosas.
Vietnamese (VI): Even though it was called a courtyard, it wasn't really a pretty place you could take a walk in like the rose garden.

Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Anche se veniva chiamato cortile, non si trattava di un bel posto in cui fare una passeggiata come nel roseto.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Anche se veniva definito un cortile, non si trattava di un posto piacevole in cui passeggiare come il roseto.
Turkish (TR): Adı avlu olsa da, gül bahçesi gibi içinde yürüyüş yapılabilecek güzel bir yer değildi.

Steam (ST): On the contrary, since it was surrounded by the mansion on all sides, it made you feel a little uncomfortable, as though it was telling you that there would be no escape from this mansion no matter where you tried to run.
Umineko Project (UP): On the contrary, since it was surrounded by the mansion on all sides, it made you feel a little discomfort, as though it was telling you that you couldn't escape from the mansion even if you tried to escape to the outside.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): On the contrary, since it was surrounded by the mansion on all sides, it made you feel a little discomfort, as though it was telling you that even if you tried to escape to the outside, you couldn't escape from the mansion.
PC Japanese (JP): むしろ、四囲を屋敷にぐるりと囲まれているため、外へ逃れようとも屋敷からは逃れられないと言われているような不気味さもわずかに感じさせた。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): むしろ、四囲を屋敷にぐるりと囲まれているため、外へ逃れようとも屋敷からは逃れられないと言われているような不気味さもわずかに感じさせた。
Russian (RU): Наоборот, так как он был со всех сторон окружен особняком, это заставляло находившегося в нём человека чувствовать себя неуютно, будто говоря, что даже если бы была предпринята попытка побега, сбежать из особняка бы не удалось.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Pelo contrário, por ser cercado pela mansão por todos os lados, faz com que você se sinta um pouco desconfortável, como se dissesse que você não pode escapar da mansão, mesmo que você tente escapar por fora.
Vietnamese (VI): On the contrary, since it was surrounded by the mansion on all sides, it made you feel a little discomfort, as though it was telling you that you couldn't escape from the mansion even if you tried to escape to the outside.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 倒不如說，由於四周被大屋徹底包圍著，讓人感到了就像是聽到它在說“就算能逃出這裡，也無法逃出大屋”的滲人之情。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 倒不如说，由于四周被大屋彻底包围着，让人感到了就像是听到它在说“就算能逃出这里，也无法逃出大屋”的渗人之情。
Indonesian (IDN): On the contrary, since it was surrounded by the mansion on all sides, it made you feel a little discomfort, as though it was telling you that you couldn't escape from the mansion even if you tried to escape to the outside.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Al contrario, essendo circondato da tutti i lati dalla villa, ti metteva un po' a disagio, come se ti stesse dicendo che anche provandoci, non saresti potuto scappare dalla villa.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Al contrario, essendo circondato dalla villa da ogni lato, conferiva un leggero sentore di disagio, come a dire che non si sarebbe riusciti a scappare dalla villa, neanche provando ad uscire fuori.
Turkish (TR): Aksine, dört bir yanı malikane ile çevrili olduğu için, dışarı çıkmaya çalışsanız bile malikaneden kaçamayacağınızı söylermiş gibi biraz rahatsız hissetmenize neden oluyordu.

Steam (ST): On the other hand, that meant that even though we could still hear the violent winds, the wind itself was blocked.
Umineko Project (UP): On the other hand, thanks to that, even though the violent winds could be heard, the wind itself was blocked.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): On the other hand, thanks to that, even though the violent winds could be heard, the wind itself was blocked.
PC Japanese (JP): もっともそのお陰で、暴風の音はするが風だけは遮られていた。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): もっともそのお陰で、暴風の音はするが風だけは遮られていた。
Russian (RU): С другой стороны, благодаря такому расположению, слышавшийся сильный ветер не задувал сюда.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por outro lado, graças a isso, mesmo que fosse possível ouvir o som da ventania impiedosa, essa mesma ventania era bloqueada.
Vietnamese (VI): On the other hand, thanks to that, even though the violent winds could be heard, the wind itself was blocked.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不過托了這個的福，雖然能聽到暴風之聲，但風卻是被擋住了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不过托了这个的福，虽然能听到暴风之声，但风却是被挡住了。
Indonesian (IDN): On the other hand, thanks to that, even though the violent winds could be heard, the wind itself was blocked.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): D'altra parte, grazie a ciò, nonostante potessimo sentire il rumore del vento feroce, il vento di per sé non poteva raggiungerci.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Tuttavia, grazie a ciò, anche se sentivamo il rumore del vento, esso non poteva raggiungerci.
Turkish (TR): Öte yandan, bu sayede şiddetli rüzgârlar duyulabilse de rüzgârın kendisini engelliyordu.

Steam (ST): Genji-san held out an umbrella, but Aunt Rosa ignored him.
Umineko Project (UP): Genji‐san held out an umbrella, but Auntie Rosa ignored him.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Genji-san held out an umbrella, but Rosa oba-san ignored him.
PC Japanese (JP): 源次さんが安傘を差し出してくれるが楼座叔母さんは無視する。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 源次さんが安傘を差し出してくれるが楼座叔母さんは無視する。
Russian (RU): Генджи‐сан протянул зонтик, но тётя Роза проигнорировала его.

Vietnamese (VI): Genji‐san held out an umbrella, but Auntie Rosa ignored him.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 源次将伞递了过去，但是楼座姑母看都不看。

Steam (ST): ...She was probably hinting that the gun took two hands, and it would be dangerous if she took the umbrella.

Turkish (TR): ...Muhtemelen silahı iki eliyle tuttuğunu, bu yüzden şemsiyeyi almasının tehlikeli olacağını çünkü silahı ateşleyemeyeceğini belirtmek istedi.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Rosa
Steam (ST): "...I-I see. Certainly, just as Genji-san and the others said, there are horrible wounds on their necks. ...The cuts are quite sharp. Almost as though they were sliced with a katana or something..."
Umineko Project (UP): "I, ......I see. Certainly, just as Genji‐san and the others said, there are horrible wounds on their necks. ......Very sharp. Almost as though they've been sliced with a katana or something..."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "I, ......I see. Certainly, just as Genji-san and the others said, there are horrible wounds on their necks. ......Very sharp. Almost as though they've been sliced with a katana or something..."
PC Japanese (JP): 「な、……なるほど。確かに、源次さんたちが言っていたように、二人の首にはひどい傷があるわね。……すごく鋭利な。まるで日本刀か何かで斬ったかのようにすっぱりね…。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「な、……なるほど。確かに、源次さんたちが言っていたように、二人の首にはひどい傷があるわね。……すごく鋭利な。まるで日本刀か何かで斬ったかのようにすっぱりね…」
Russian (RU): "Я... я вижу. Разумеется, как и говорили Генджи‐сан и остальные, здесь на шее ужасные раны. ......Очень острые. Как будто бы их рубили катаной или чем‐то подобным..."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Eu, ...eu entendo. Certamente, assim como o Genji‐san e os outros disseram, eles tinham horríveis feridas em seus pescoços. ......Os cortes eram bem precisos. Quase como se eles tivessem sido fatiados como uma katana ou algo assim..."
Vietnamese (VI): "I, ......I see. Certainly, just as Genji‐san and the others said, there are horrible wounds on their necks. ......Very sharp. Almost as though they've been sliced with a katana or something..."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「原、……原來如此。倒確實是，如源次你們所說，兩人的脖子上有不得了的傷口呢。……簡直就像是，用十分鋒利的日本刀什麼的斬過般利落的切口…」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「原、……原来如此。倒确实是，如源次你们所说，两人的脖子上有不得了的伤口呢。……简直就像是，用十分锋利的日本刀什么的斩过般利落的切口…」

Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "C... Capisco. Senza dubbio, ci sono delle ferite orribili sul loro collo, proprio come avevano detto Genji-san e gli altri. ... Molto sottili. Quasi come se fossero stati tagliati con una katana o qualcosa di simile..."
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "...C-Capisco. In effetti, come avevano detto Genji-san e gli altri, sul loro collo ci sono delle ferite orribili... Sono decisamente nette. Proprio come se fossero stati tagliati con una katana, o con qualcosa di simile..."
Turkish (TR): "A-......anlıyorum. Gerçekten de, Genji-san ve diğerlerinin söylediği gibi, boyunlarında korkunç yaralar var. ......Çok keskin. Adeta katana gibi bir şeyle kesilmişler gibi..."

Steam (ST): Those gaping wounds on their necks definitely made me want to avert my eyes, but after seeing that Halloween party in the chapel, even though they looked horrible, they were no longer enough to make me feel sick.
Umineko Project (UP): That gaping wound on their necks definitely made me want to avert my eyes, but after seeing the Halloween party in the chapel, even though I thought it was horrible, it was no longer enough to make me feel sick.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): That gaping wound on their necks definitely made me want to avert my eyes, but after seeing the Halloween party in the chapel, even though I thought it was horrible, it was no longer enough to make me feel sick.
PC Japanese (JP): そのばっくりと開いた首の傷は確かに目を背けたくなるものだったが、礼拝堂のハロウィンパーティを見た俺には、惨いとは思っても、もはや吐き気を催すほどのものではなかった。

Turkish (TR): Boyunlarındaki o derin yara kesinlikle gözlerimi kaçırmak istememe neden oldu, ancak kilisedeki Cadılar Bayramı partisini gördükten sonra, her ne kadar korkunç olduğunu düşünsem de, artık midemi bulandırmaya yetmiyordu.

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): だから、その倒れたものを見て初めて俺は、これがナイフではなく、杭のようなものであることを理解する。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Então, quando eu vi ela caída, pela primeira vez, eu percebi que não era uma faca, mas algo como uma estaca.
Vietnamese (VI): So, it was only when I saw that one that had fallen over, that for the first time, I realized that it wasn't a knife, but something like a stake.

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Perciò, solo quando osservai l'arnese caduto via, mi accorsi che non era un coltello, ma qualcosa di simile ad un picchetto.
Turkish (TR): Bu sayede, ilk kez yere düşmüş olan bir tanesini gördüğümde bunun bir bıçak değil, kazık gibi bir şey olduğunu fark ettim.

Steam (ST): Its full length was probably about 30 centimeters. It was probably made out of bronze or iron or something of the sort.
Umineko Project (UP): Its full length was probably about thirty centimeters.{n}It was probably made out of bronze or iron or something of the sort.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Its full length was probably about 30 centimeters. It was probably made out of bronze or iron or something of the sort.

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 全長は多分、３０ｃｍあるかないか。{n}青銅とか鉄とか、そういう類のもので出来ているのだろう。
Russian (RU): Он был около 30 сантиметров в длину.{n}Изготовлен он был из бронзы или железа или какого‐то схожего металла.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Seu comprimento total era de cerca de 30 cm.{n}Era provavelmente feita de bronze, ferro ou algo semelhante.
Vietnamese (VI): Its full length was probably about thirty centimeters.{n}It was probably made out of bronze or iron or something of the sort.

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): La sua lunghezza totale si aggirava intorno ai trenta centimetri.{n}Probabilmente era composto da bronzo o ferro, o da un altro materiale del genere.
Turkish (TR): Tam uzunluğu muhtemelen otuz santimetre civarındaydı.{n}Tahminen bronz, demir ya da benzeri bir şeyden yapılmıştı.

Steam (ST): Even without touching it, I could tell it had some weight to it. It was composed of a grip and a cone-shaped part, and it was obviously made to be a piercing weapon.
Umineko Project (UP): Even without touching it, I could tell that it had some weight to it.{n}It was composed of a grip and a cone‐shaped part, and it was obviously made to be a piercing weapon.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Even without touching it, I noticed that it had some weight to it. It was composed of a grip and a cone-shaped part, and it was obviously made to be a piercing weapon.
PC Japanese (JP): 手に触れずとも重みのあるものであることがわかる。握りと、円錐部分で構成されていて、明らかに刺すための武器として作られたものだとわかる。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 手に触れずとも重みのあるものであることがわかる。{n}握りと、円錐部分で構成されていて、明らかに刺すための武器として作られたものだとわかる。
Russian (RU): Даже не касаясь его, я заметил, что он имеет определённый вес.{n}Он состоял из рукоятки и конусообразной части и было очевидно, что это проникающее оружие.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mesmo sem tocar nela, eu podia dizer que ela não era tão leve.{n}Era composta de uma empunhadura e uma parte em forma de cone e, obviamente, foi feita para ser usada como uma arma.
Vietnamese (VI): Even without touching it, I could tell that it had some weight to it.{n}It was composed of a grip and a cone‐shaped part, and it was obviously made to be a piercing weapon.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不用碰，就知道這玩意有分量。{n}整體以柄部，與圓錐部分構成，很明顯是用來刺的武器。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不用碰，就知道这玩意有分量。{n}整体以柄部，与圆锥部分构成，很明显是用来刺的武器。
Indonesian (IDN): Even without touching it, I could tell that it had some weight to it.{n}It was composed of a grip and a cone‐shaped part, and it was obviously made to be a piercing weapon.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Anche senza toccarlo, mi accorsi che doveva essere piuttosto pesante. {n}Era composto da un manico e una parte conica, ed era stato palesemente costruito per essere un'arma in grado di perforare.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Non mi serviva toccarlo per capirne la pesantezza.{n}Era composto da un manico e da una sezione conica, ed era stato palesemente costruito per essere un'arma perforante.
Turkish (TR): Dokunmadan bile biraz ağır olduğunu söyleyebilirdim.{n}Bir sap ve koni şeklindeki bir kısımdan oluşuyordu ve açık bir şekilde delici bir silah olarak tasarlanmıştı.

Steam (ST): Maybe it was like a miniature version of those lances western knights used on horseback.
Umineko Project (UP): Maybe you could describe it like a miniature version of those lances Western knights used on horseback.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Maybe it seemed like a miniature version of those lances western knights used on horseback.
PC Japanese (JP): 例えるなら、西洋騎士が使う騎乗槍をミニチュアにしたような感じなのか。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 例えるなら、西洋騎士が使う騎乗槍をミニチュアにしたような感じなのか。
Russian (RU): Он скорее напоминал миниатюрную версию тех копий, которые западные рыцари использовали верхом на лошадях.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Talvez você pudesse descrevê‐la como uma versão em miniatura daquelas lanças ocidentais que os cavaleiros usavam ao cavalgarem.
Vietnamese (VI): Maybe you could describe it like a miniature version of those lances Western knights used on horseback.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 打個比方來說的話，那就是有點將西方騎士用的騎槍迷你化了的感覺。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 打个比方来说的话，那就是有点将西方骑士用的骑枪迷你化了的感觉。
Indonesian (IDN): Maybe you could describe it like a miniature version of those lances Western knights used on horseback.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Forse assomigliava ad una miniatura di quelle lance che I cavalieri occidentali usavano a cavallo.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Se si dovesse fare un paragone, ricordava una miniatura di quelle lance da cavalleria impiegate dai cavalieri europei.
Turkish (TR): Bunu, Batılı şövalyelerin at sırtında kullandıkları mızrakların minyatür bir versiyonu olarak tanımlayabilirdiniz.

Steam (ST): The spiral-shaped ditches in it made it also look like a small drill.
Umineko Project (UP): The grooves that had been carved in a spiral shape made it also look like a drill.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The ditch that had been inscribed in a spiral shape made it also look like a drill.

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 螺旋状に刻まれた溝は、あるいは小さなドリルのようにも見えた。

Vietnamese (VI): The grooves that had been carved in a spiral shape made it also look like a drill.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 雕刻着的螺旋状沟槽，使之也能看成为小钻头。

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): A loro volta, i solchi intagliati a mo' di spirale la facevano assomigliare ad una trivella...
Turkish (TR): Spiral şeklinde oyulmuş oluklar da onu bir matkap gibi gösteriyordu.

Steam (ST): ...However, the grip had an occult design modeled off a demon or something, so instead of a weapon used in war, it felt like something that would be used in a ceremony to offer up living sacrifices.
Umineko Project (UP): ......However, the grip had an occult‐like design of a demon or something, so instead of a weapon used in war, it felt like something that would be used in a ritual to offer up a sacrifice.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......However, the grip had an occult-like design of a demon or something, so instead of a weapon used in war, it felt like something that would be used in a ceremony to offer up a sacrifice.
PC Japanese (JP): ……しかし、握りの部分には、オカルト染みた、悪魔か何かの意匠が施されていて、戦争に使う武器というよりは、生贄を捧げるのに使う儀式用という感じだった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ……しかし、握りの部分には、オカルト染みた、悪魔か何かの意匠が施されていて、戦争に使う武器というよりは、生贄を捧げるのに使う儀式用という感じだった。
Russian (RU): ......Однако рукоятка была выполнена в каком‐то оккультно‐демоническом стиле, в отличие от оружия, используемого на войне, оно наводило на мысли, что его используют во время жертвенного ритуала.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......No entanto, a empunhadura tinha um design meio oculto de um demônio ou algo do tipo, por isso, em vez de uma arma de guerra, parecia mais como algo que seria usado em uma cerimônia para oferecer sacrifícios.
Vietnamese (VI): ......However, the grip had an occult‐like design of a demon or something, so instead of a weapon used in war, it felt like something that would be used in a ritual to offer up a sacrifice.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……不過，用來握的柄部，卻是被刻上了富有神秘學色彩，代表著惡魔的圖案，感覺比起說它是用於戰爭的武器，更像是用來獻上活祭的，儀式用具。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……不过，用来握的柄部，却是被刻上了富有神秘学色彩，代表着恶魔的图案，感觉比起说它是用于战争的武器，更像是用来献上活祭的，仪式用具。
Indonesian (IDN): ......However, the grip had an occult‐like design of a demon or something, so instead of a weapon used in war, it felt like something that would be used in a ritual to offer up a sacrifice.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Tuttavia, il manico aveva una decorazione dall'aspetto occulto che riprendeva un demone o qualcosa del genere, perciò anziché un'arma da usare in guerra, il pugnale sembrava piuttosto uno strumento da usare in una cerimonia per offrire un sacrificio.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Tuttavia, sulla parte del manico erano stati apposti dei motivi di un qualche demone dalle parvenze occulte, per cui, più che un'arma da usare in guerra,  sembrava uno strumento cerimoniale per offrire un sacrificio.
Turkish (TR): ......Fakat sapında okült benzeri bir iblis tasarımı vardı, yani savaşta kullanılacak bir silahtan ziyade, bir ritüelde kurban sunmak için kullanılacak bir şey gibi hissettiriyordu.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler

Steam (ST): "N-No way...!! Why didn't you tell us something that...wait, no, ...why didn't you think that was suspicious?!"

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Estava sujo como o final de uma brincadeira de crianças do jardim de infância brincando com lama.
Vietnamese (VI): ......It was dirtied like the aftermath of a kindergartner playing in the mud.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……這污跡，就感覺像是幼兒園的小孩玩過泥巴後留下的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……这污迹，就感觉像是幼儿园的小孩玩过泥巴后留下的。
Indonesian (IDN): ......It was dirtied like the aftermath of a kindergartner playing in the mud.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Il modo in cui era stata imbrattata ricordava il pasticcio combinato da un bambino dell'asilo dopo che ha giocato nel fango.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Il modo in cui era stata insudiciata era simile al pasticcio combinato da un bambino dell'asilo dopo aver giocato nel fango.
Turkish (TR): ......Çamurda oynayan bir anaokulu öğrencisinin işiymiş gibi görünüyordu.

Steam (ST): I didn't know what it could mean. ...The bright-red paint that had been slathered on was dripping down, and even though no one said it, it made us think of blood.
Umineko Project (UP): I didn't know what it could mean.{n}...The bright‐red paint that had been slathered on was dripping down, and even though no one said it, it made us think of blood.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I didn't know what it could mean....The bright-red paint that had been slathered on was dripping down, and even though no one said it, it made us think of blood.
PC Japanese (JP): それが何を意味するかなんて、わからない。…真っ赤に塗りたくられた塗料はところどころが垂れて、誰が言わずとも血を想起させた。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): それが何を意味するかなんて、わからない。{n}…真っ赤に塗りたくられた塗料はところどころが垂れて、誰が言わずとも血を想起させた。
Russian (RU): Я не знал, что это могло означать.{n}...Ярко‐красная краска продолжала стекать вниз, и хотя никто не произнёс этого вслух, она заставила нас думать о крови.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu não sei o que isso poderia significar.{n}...Aquele vermelho rubro que fora pintado estava escorrendo, e mesmo sem ninguém dizer nada, fez com que pensássemos que era sangue.
Vietnamese (VI): I didn't know what it could mean.{n}...The bright‐red paint that had been slathered on was dripping down, and even though no one said it, it made us think of blood.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不知這到底有何用意。{n}…塗抹著的紅色塗料，垂下了一道道痕跡，不用說就讓人聯想到了血。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不知这到底有何用意。{n}…涂抹着的红色涂料，垂下了一道道痕迹，不用说就让人联想到了血。
Indonesian (IDN): I didn't know what it could mean.{n}...The bright‐red paint that had been slathered on was dripping down, and even though no one said it, it made us think of blood.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Non sapevo che potesse significare. ... La vernice rosso vivo che era stata spalmata sulla porta stava colando, e anche se nessuno lo disse, ci ricordò il sangue.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Non sapevo cosa potesse significare...{n}La vernice spalmata, che possedeva un rosso intenso, stava colando, e anche se nessuno l'aveva detto, richiamava alla mente il sangue.
Turkish (TR): Bunun ne anlama gelebileceğini bilmiyordum.{n}...Üstüne sürülen parlak kırmızı boya aşağıya damlıyordu ve kimse bunu söylememiş olsa da bize kanı çağrıştırıyordu.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Rosa

Umineko Project (UP): "...G‐...Genji‐san, please open it."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "...G, ...Genji-san, please open it."

Steam (ST): Aunt Rosa held her gun up high and ordered Genji-san to open the door.
Umineko Project (UP): Auntie Rosa held her gun up high and ordered Genji‐san to open it.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Rosa oba-san held her gun up high and ordered Genji-san to open it.

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 楼座叔母さんは銃を高く構えると、源次さんに開けるように促す。

Chinese Simplified (CN): 楼座姑母高高举起枪，催促源次去开门。

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Tenendo il fucile alto, zia Rosa ordinò a Genji-san di aprire.
Turkish (TR): Rosa Teyze silahını havaya kaldırdı ve Genji-san'a kapıyı açmasını emretti.

Steam (ST): Genji-san approached it without seeming particularly troubled by that stuff on it...and turned the knob, but immediately turned around, shaking his head.
Umineko Project (UP): Genji‐san approached the door without being particularly troubled by that stuff on it, and turned the knob, but he immediately turned around, shaking his head.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Genji-san approached the door without being particularly troubled by that stuff on it, and turned the knob, but immediately turned around, shaking his head.
PC Japanese (JP): 源次さんは特に扉のそれを嫌がることもなく近付き、ノブを回すが、すぐに首を横に振りながら振り返った。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 源次さんは特に扉のそれを嫌がることもなく近付き、ノブを回すが、すぐに首を横に振りながら振り返った。
Russian (RU): Не особо придавая значения нарисованному на двери, Генджи‐сан подошел к ней и повернул дверную ручку, после чего незамедлительно повернулся и покачал головой.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O Genji‐san se aproximou da porta, sem aparentar nenhum problema com aquilo, e girou a maçaneta, mas ele imediatamente se virou, sacudindo a cabeça.
Vietnamese (VI): Genji‐san approached the door without being particularly troubled by that stuff on it, and turned the knob, but he immediately turned around, shaking his head.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 源次並沒有表現出不想靠近門上的那東西，走了過去轉了下門把手，然後馬上就回頭轉身望向了我們。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 源次并没有表现出不想靠近门上的那东西，走了过去转了下门把手，然后马上就回头转身望向了我们。
Indonesian (IDN): Genji‐san approached the door without being particularly troubled by that stuff on it, and turned the knob, but he immediately turned around, shaking his head.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Genji-san si avvicinò alla porta senza farsi troppo impressionare dalla roba che vi era sopra, e girò la maniglia, ma si voltò subito verso di noi, scuotendo la testa.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Genji-san si avvicinò alla porta, senza lasciarsi troppo impressionare da quello che c'era sopra, e girò la maniglia, ma subito dopo si girò verso di noi, scuotendo la testa.
Turkish (TR): Genji-san, kapının üzerindeki şeylerden pek de rahatsız olmadan kapıya yaklaştı ve tokmağı çevirdi, ancak hemen arkasını dönerek başını salladı.

Umineko Project (UP): It was locked.

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Era chiusa a chiave.

Original Witch Hunt (OG): Right now, there was only one person in this mansion who could lock and unlock doors at will, Rosa oba-san.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Rosa
Steam (ST): "Hey, Battler-kun!! You mustn't touch anything until the police come!! What do you think you're doing, touching it?! What will you do if our precious evidence on the scene gets disturbed?!!"
Umineko Project (UP): "Hey, Battler‐kun!! We have to leave everything alone until the police come!! What do you think you're doing, touching it?! What will you do if our precious evidence from the crime scene gets disturbed?!!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Hey, Battler-kun!! You must leave everything alone until the police come!! What do you think you're doing, touching it?! What will you do if our precious proof on the scene gets disturbed?!!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「こら、戦人くんッ！！　警察が来るまでそっとしておかないと駄目よ！！　勝手に触って、どういうつもり？！　せっかくの現場証拠がおかしくなっちゃったらどうするのよッ！！」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「こら、戦人くんッ！！　警察が来るまでそっとしておかないと駄目よ！！　勝手に触って、どういうつもり？！　せっかくの現場証拠がおかしくなっちゃったらどうするのよッ！！」
Russian (RU): "Эй, Баттлер‐кун! Просто оставь всё так как есть до приезда полиции! О чём ты думал, трогая тут всё?! Что ты будешь делать, если драгоценные доказательства с места преступления будут испорчены?!!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Ei, Battler‐kun!! Nós temos que deixar tudo assim até que a polícia chegue!!{n}O que você acha que está fazendo, tocando nisso?! O que você vai fazer se a nossa preciosa evidência da cena do crime for modificada?!"
Vietnamese (VI): "Hey, Battler‐kun!! We have to leave everything alone until the police come!! What do you think you're doing, touching it?! What will you do if our precious evidence from the crime scene gets disturbed?!!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「喂！戰人君！！警察來之前不保持原狀可不行！！隨便亂碰，是想幹什麼啊？！寶貴的現場證據要是被破壞了該怎麼辦！！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「喂！战人君！！警察来之前不保持原状可不行！！随便乱碰，是想干什么啊？！宝贵的现场证据要是被破坏了该怎么办！！」
Indonesian (IDN): "Hey, Battler‐kun!! We have to leave everything alone until the police come!! What do you think you're doing, touching it?! What will you do if our precious evidence from the crime scene gets disturbed?!!"
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Ehi, Battler-kun!! Devi lasciare tutto com'è fino all'arrivo della polizia!! {n}Che pensi di fare toccando qualcosa?! Che farai se le nostre preziose prove sulla scena del crimine si riveleranno inquinate?!!"
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "Ehi, Battler‐kun!! Dobbiamo lasciare tutto così com'è fino all'arrivo della polizia!! Cosa pensi di ottenere, mettendoci mano di tua iniziativa?! Cosa faremo se le prove della scena del crimine per cui abbiamo tanto penato si riveleranno inquinate?!!"
Turkish (TR): "Hey, Battler-kun!! Polis gelene kadar her şeyi kendi haline bırakmalıyız!! Ne yaptığını sanıyorsun, dokunuyor musun?! Suç mahallindeki önemli deliller bozulursa ne yapacaksın?!!"

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 楼座叔母さんに激しく怒られ、後ろ襟まで引っ張られる。

Speaker: Ushiromiya Maria
Steam (ST): "...It's okay, Battler. ...If you're with me, you'll be okay. ......The witch is very fickle, and she's a terrifying being who might kill humans partly for fun sometimes."
Umineko Project (UP): "......It'll be alright, Battler. ......If you're with me, it'll be alright. .........Witches are very fickle, and they're terrifying beings who maybe kill humans for fun sometimes."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......It's alright, Battler. ......If you're with Maria, it's alright. .........The witch is very fickle, and she's a terrifying being who maybe kills humans for fun sometimes."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……大丈夫だよ、戦人。……真里亞と居れば、大丈夫。………魔女はとても気まぐれで、時に面白半分に人間を殺すかもしれない恐ろしい存在だけれども。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……大丈夫だよ、戦人。……真里亞と居れば、大丈夫。………魔女はとても気まぐれで、時に面白半分に人間を殺すかもしれない恐ろしい存在だけれども」
Russian (RU): "......Всё в порядке, Баттлер. ......Если ты с Марией, то всё в порядке. .........Ведьма очень непостоянна и она страшное создание, которое вполне может иногда убивать людей ради забавы."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Vai ficar tudo bem, Battler. ......Se você ficar com a Maria, tudo vai ficar bem. .........Bruxas são muito caprichosas, e são seres terríveis que muitas vezes matam humanos só por diversão."
Vietnamese (VI): "......It'll be alright, Battler. ......If you're with me, it'll be alright. .........Witches are very fickle, and they're terrifying beings who maybe kill humans for fun sometimes."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……沒事的啦，戰人。……和真里亞一起，就沒事的。………雖然或許魔女是個非常隨心所欲，有時會鬧著玩地殺死人類的恐怖存在。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……没事的啦，战人。……和真里亚一起，就没事的。………虽然或许魔女是个非常随心所欲，有时会闹着玩地杀死人类的恐怖存在。」
Indonesian (IDN): "......It'll be alright, Battler. ......If you're with me, it'll be alright. .........Witches are very fickle, and they're terrifying beings who maybe kill humans for fun sometimes."
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Andrà tutto bene, Battler. ... Se sei con Maria, andrà tutto bene. ... La strega è molto volubile, ed è una creatura spaventosa che forse alle volte uccide gli esseri umani per divertimento."
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "...Andrà tutto bene, Battler... Se sarai con Maria, andrà tutto bene... Le strege sono esseri molto capricciosi e terrificanti, che a volte possono uccidere gli umani per divertimento..."
Turkish (TR): "......Her şey yoluna girecek, Battler. ......Maria ile birlikte olursan, iyi olacaksın. .........Cadılar oldukça dönek ve zaman zaman sırf eğlence olsun diye insanları öldürebilen korkunç varlıklardır."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Maria

Umineko Project (UP): "...But, if you're together with me, it'll definitely be alright. So, don't be afraid."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "...However, if you're together with Maria, it's alright. So, don't be afraid."

Steam (ST): After Aunt Rosa finished investigating their corpses, she announced that she'd seal this room again, chased the rest of us out, stole back the master key she'd lent me, and locked the door again.
Umineko Project (UP): After Auntie Rosa finished investigating their deaths, she proclaimed that she would seal this room again, chased the rest of us out, stole back the master key she had lent me, and locked the door again.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): After Rosa oba-san finished investigating their deaths, she proclaimed that she would seal this room again, chased the rest of us out, stole back the master key she had lent me, and locked the door again.
PC Japanese (JP): 楼座叔母さんは３人の検死が終わると、この部屋を再び封印すると宣言し、一方的に俺たちを追い出し、俺に預けたマスターキーを奪い返して、再び施錠した。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 楼座叔母さんは３人の検死が終わると、この部屋を再び封印すると宣言し、一方的に俺たちを追い出し、俺に預けたマスターキーを奪い返して、再び施錠した。
Russian (RU): После того, как тётя Роза закончила расследование их смерти, она объявила, что снова запечатает эту комнату, выгнала нас, забрала у меня универсальный ключ, и снова заперла дверь.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Depois da tia Rosa terminar de investigar as suas mortes, ela proclamou que iria selar o quarto de novo, mandando o resto de nós sair, ela pegou de volta a chave mestra que havia me emprestado, e trancou a porta mais uma vez.
Vietnamese (VI): After Auntie Rosa finished investigating their deaths, she proclaimed that she would seal this room again, chased the rest of us out, stole back the master key she had lent me, and locked the door again.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 樓座姑母驗完三人的屍體後，說了這屋子也要封起來，單方面地把我們趕了出去，搶過剛才給我的總鑰匙，鎖好了門。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 楼座姑母验完三人的尸体后，说了这屋子也要封起来，单方面地把我们赶了出去，抢过刚才给我的总钥匙，锁好了门。
Indonesian (IDN): After Auntie Rosa finished investigating their deaths, she proclaimed that she would seal this room again, chased the rest of us out, stole back the master key she had lent me, and locked the door again.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Dopo aver finito di esaminare i corpi, Rosa oba-san annunciò che avrebbe sigillato di nuovo questa stanza, cacciò fuori noialtri, strappò via da me il passepartout che mi aveva prestato, e chiuse di nuovo la porta a chiave.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Dopo aver finito di esaminare i cadaveri, zia Rosa proclamò che avrebbe nuovamente sigillato la stanza, cacciandoci fuori in modo dispotico, si riprese da me il passepartout che mi aveva affidato, e chiuse di nuovo la porta a chiave.
Turkish (TR): Rosa Teyze onların ölümlerini incelemeyi bitirdikten sonra, bu odayı tekrar mühürleyeceğini ilan etti, hepimizi dışarı çıkardı, bana ödünç verdiği master anahtarı geri aldı ve kapıyı tekrar kilitledi.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Rosa
Steam (ST): "...It's a wolves and sheep puzzle. Why would a sheep be safe if it was all alone, and therefore in its weakest possible position?"

Speaker: Ronoue Genji

Steam (ST): She opened the curtains and checked again to make sure the windows were locked. As I watched...how should I say it, I felt like it didn't really matter anymore.
Umineko Project (UP): She opened the curtains, and checked again to make sure the windows were locked.{n}As I watched, ......how should I say it, I felt like it didn't really matter anymore.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): She opened the curtains, and checked again to make sure the windows were locked. As I watched, ......how should I say it, I felt like it didn't really matter anymore.

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): カーテンを開け、窓の施錠を再び確認している。{n}それを見る俺は、……何というのか、もうどうでもいい気分だった。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ela abriu as cortinas e checou novamente para ter certeza de que as janelas estavam trancadas.{n}Enquanto eu observava, ......como posso dizer, eu senti como se mais nada importasse.

Steam (ST): If I said anything careless, it would turn into another fight. For a while, I gazed at her from the corridor, figured I'd waited just about long enough, and entered the parlor behind her.
Umineko Project (UP): If I said anything unnecessary, it would turn into another fight.{n}For a while, I gazed at her from the corridor, figured I had waited just about long enough, and entered the parlor behind her.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): If I said anything unnecessary, it would turn into another fight. For a while, I gazed at her from the corridor, figured I had waited just about long enough, and entered the parlor behind her.
PC Japanese (JP): 余計なことを言えばまた喧嘩になる。俺はしばらくの間、その様子を廊下で眺め、もうそろそろいいかなと思い、それを尻目に勝手に客間に入る。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 余計なことを言えばまた喧嘩になる。{n}俺はしばらくの間、その様子を廊下で眺め、もうそろそろいいかなと思い、それを尻目に勝手に客間に入る。
Russian (RU): Если бы я сказал что‐нибудь лишнее, это бы превратилось в ещё один спор.{n}Некоторое время я пристально наблюдал за ней из коридора, и, наконец, решив, что прождал достаточно долго, я вошёл в гостиную следом за ней.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Se eu dissesse qualquer coisa desnecessária, isso poderia começar outra discussão. Por algum tempo, eu observei ela do corredor, pensando se eu já tinha esperado o bastante, e entrei na sala de visitas atrás delas.

Chinese Traditional (CHT): 多說話又會引起口角。{n}我在片刻間，待在走廊上看著她忙里忙外。到覺得已經差不多了的時候，便不再多留心，顧自進了客廳。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 多说话又会引起口角。{n}我在片刻间，待在走廊上看着她忙里忙外。到觉得已经差不多了的时候，便不再多留心，顾自进了客厅。

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Se avessi detto qualcosa di troppo, avrei scatenato un altro putiferio.{n}La osservai dal corridoio per un po', per poi decidere di essere rimasto lì per abbastanza tempo, e entrai in salotto di mia iniziativa, senza far caso a lei...

Umineko Project (UP): ......If she can't trust anyone but the dead, she should just go around killing everyone with the gun she's got in her hand.

Steam (ST): And then, in the end, she'll realize that she herself is the wolf. ...Then she can just blast through the head of the final wolf and close the curtain on this insane murder drama...
Umineko Project (UP): And then in the end, she'll realize that she herself was the wolf.{n}...And then she can blast through the head of the final wolf, and the curtain will close on this insane murder theater...

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): そしたら最後には自分が狼であることに気付く。{n}…そして最後の狼の頭を、自分でブチ抜いて、このおかしな殺人劇に幕を下ろせばいい…。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): E, no final, ela iria perceber que ela mesma é o lobo.{n}...Então ela poderia disparar contra a cabeça do último lobo, e as cortinas desses assassinatos insanos se fechariam...

Steam (ST): As I thought that bitterly, I returned to the sofa where I'd been encamped before, rudely resting both of my feet on the table...

Steam (ST): Kinzo, as though he had suddenly remembered something, approached the chess set. It was as it had been during the game he'd played with Nanjo until yesterday.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kinzo
Steam (ST): "......That's right. Like this. ......I advanced my queen. ...That was quite a spectacular move. Perhaps it was a little too intense for you. ......I worried whether you'd abandon your piece or not, ...worried for so long......"
Umineko Project (UP): ".........That's right. Like this. ............I advanced my queen. ...That was a very spectacular move. It might have been a little too intense for you. .........I deliberated whether you would throw away your piece or not, ......deliberated and deliberated............"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ".........That's right. Like this. ............I advanced my queen. ...That was a very spectacular move. That move might have been a little too intense for you. .........I worried about whether you would throw away your piece or not, ......I kept worrying............"
PC Japanese (JP): 「………そうだ。こうだ。…………私はクイーンを進めた。…とても良い妙手だった。お前には少々きつすぎるかも知れん一手だった。………お前は、駒を見捨てるか、見捨てないかに悩み、……ずっと悩み……………。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………そうだ。こうだ。…………私はクイーンを進めた。…とても良い妙手だった。お前には少々きつすぎるかも知れん一手だった。………お前は、駒を見捨てるか、見捨てないかに悩み、……ずっと悩み……………」
Russian (RU): ".........Всё верно. Именно так. ............Я выдвинул свою королеву. ...Это был очень эффектный ход. Этот ход, возможно, заставил тебя поднапрячься. .........Я волновался, бросишь ли ты свою фигуру или нет... я продолжал беспокоиться..."

Pode ter sido um pouco intenso para você. .........Eu deliberadamente pensei se você jogaria sua peça fora ou não, ......estava preocupado se faria isso............"
Vietnamese (VI): ".........That's right. Like this. ............I advanced my queen. ...That was a very spectacular move. It might have been a little too intense for you. .........I deliberated whether you would throw away your piece or not, ......deliberated and deliberated............"
